0a39f78bcb297ab0ebe8a29c28bfed89 (20:51): Title: HTML Weekly Teleconference -- 15 Oct 2009 (at www.w3.org)

a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (20:51): (Well, if MikeSmith removes the noise at start/end)
f13bb1bed03db9d68a7d9a48aafeec78 (20:52): right, so I'm not certain how HTML WG formats the minutes... but the following things jump out at me:
f13bb1bed03db9d68a7d9a48aafeec78 (20:52): the Present/Regrets list looks wrong
f13bb1bed03db9d68a7d9a48aafeec78 (20:53): the Action Items are wrong...
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (20:53): As far as I can tell, it depends on who does the minutes :)
f13bb1bed03db9d68a7d9a48aafeec78 (20:53): ha, well, I did them wrong, then.
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (20:53): (And they're quite often a lot worse than that)
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (20:53): typically nobody cares
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (20:53): There's no real consistency, so I'm not sure you can be wrong. :)
6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (20:53): so typically I don't bother to fix stuff like that
f13bb1bed03db9d68a7d9a48aafeec78 (20:54): hrm... let me check some stuff... make sure I didn't screw up the action items...
f13bb1bed03db9d68a7d9a48aafeec78 (20:56): Chair: Paul_Cotton
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (20:56): wonders why the need for the underscore

f13bb1bed03db9d68a7d9a48aafeec78 (20:58): habit - When you don't use underscores in the present list, rrsagent treats it as two different people, so - Paul Cotton would be two people - "Paul" and "Cotton"
f13bb1bed03db9d68a7d9a48aafeec78 (20:58): I don't think you need it for Chair: ... let's see
f13bb1bed03db9d68a7d9a48aafeec78 (20:58): Chair: Paul Cotton
f13bb1bed03db9d68a7d9a48aafeec78 (20:58): rrsagent, draft minutes
4e63bbbffbcaf12608512401eaf11240 (20:58): I have made the request to generate http://www.w3.org/2009/10/15-html-wg-minutes.html f13bb1bed03db9d68a7d9a48aafeec78
0a39f78bcb297ab0ebe8a29c28bfed89 (20:58): Title: HTML Weekly Teleconference -- 15 Oct 2009 (at www.w3.org)
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (20:58): I had it like that before :)
f13bb1bed03db9d68a7d9a48aafeec78 (20:58): no need for underscores...
f13bb1bed03db9d68a7d9a48aafeec78 (20:58): in 'Chair:', specifically
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (20:59): Right, I know it's often used elsewhere
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (20:59): (I don't think it's required anywhere)
f13bb1bed03db9d68a7d9a48aafeec78 (21:02): damn, time pressures - gotta go
f13bb1bed03db9d68a7d9a48aafeec78 (21:02): The minutes look good Geoffrey  - thanks a bunch for cleaning them up
f13bb1bed03db9d68a7d9a48aafeec78 (21:02): :)
f13bb1bed03db9d68a7d9a48aafeec78 (21:02): Oh a completely unrelated note, I need to chat with you about Anolis at some point in the future...
f13bb1bed03db9d68a7d9a48aafeec78 (21:03): Specifically about asking if it can generate HTML 4.01(strict.dtd)...
f13bb1bed03db9d68a7d9a48aafeec78 (21:03): I was asked to re-format the HTML+RDFa spec as HTML 4.01 for publishing (it didn't pass W3C pubrules as HTML5)
f13bb1bed03db9d68a7d9a48aafeec78 (21:04): Sooo, I had to pass it through tidy... which generated 4.01 (transitional.dtd), not (strict.dtd).
f13bb1bed03db9d68a7d9a48aafeec78 (21:04): I was wondering if there was some magic flag I could pass to it that would generate an HTML5 document that Tidy could clean into a HTML4.01 strict document?
f13bb1bed03db9d68a7d9a48aafeec78 (21:04): or if there was a HTML 4.01 (strict.dtd) output option?
f13bb1bed03db9d68a7d9a48aafeec78 (21:05): rrsagent, bye
4e63bbbffbcaf12608512401eaf11240 (21:05): I see 4 open action items saved in http://www.w3.org/2009/10/08-html-wg-actions.rdf :

4e63bbbffbcaf12608512401eaf11240 (21:05): recorded in http://www.w3.org/2009/10/08-html-wg-irc#T16-30-41
4e63bbbffbcaf12608512401eaf11240 (21:05): ACTION: Paul to enter a bugzilla entry on MathML 3.0 [2]
4e63bbbffbcaf12608512401eaf11240 (21:05): recorded in http://www.w3.org/2009/10/08-html-wg-irc#T16-33-46
4e63bbbffbcaf12608512401eaf11240 (21:05): ACTION: Maciej to outline unconference format for F2F meeting - 1 week [3]
4e63bbbffbcaf12608512401eaf11240 (21:05): recorded in http://www.w3.org/2009/10/15-html-wg-irc#T16-41-12
4e63bbbffbcaf12608512401eaf11240 (21:05): ACTION: paulc (or Mike smith) to check on room size and number - 1 week [4]
4e63bbbffbcaf12608512401eaf11240 (21:05): recorded in http://www.w3.org/2009/10/15-html-wg-irc#T16-42-00
f13bb1bed03db9d68a7d9a48aafeec78 (21:06): Also, why does Anolis strip '"' characters around attribute values in the generated document?
f13bb1bed03db9d68a7d9a48aafeec78 (21:07): ... and do you prefer to be refered to as Geoffrey, Geoff, a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 or Sneddon?

6d05f0c2942adc25946a4b02b37ffa00 (21:23): two hours from now
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (21:25): I'll look for him when he gets back

a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (21:40): f13bb1bed03db9d68a7d9a48aafeec78: Anolis runs a full parser and serializer (by default in the form of html5lib, which has a bunch of options which control how the serializing is done, including that of quotation marks around attr values)

a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (21:40): f13bb1bed03db9d68a7d9a48aafeec78: The issues with the DOCTYPE are a issue with html5lib (which I had some intention of working on soon). It should work with HTML 4.01 fine, though, if you f13bb1bed03db9d68a7d9a48aafeec78ally re-add the DOCTYPE.
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (21:41): f13bb1bed03db9d68a7d9a48aafeec78: As for name, Geoffrey, a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554, Snedders‚Ä¶ it's all fine‚Ä¶ Just not Geoff. :)
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (21:42): f13bb1bed03db9d68a7d9a48aafeec78: If there are any other issues with using HTML 4.01 apart from the DOCTYPE, send me an email or ping me on IRC
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (21:54): Isn't there some command-line option to change the quoting behaviour?
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (21:55): Also thre is an option in pimpmyspec.net
3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2 (21:55): f13bb1bed03db9d68a7d9a48aafeec78: You could use some command-line option to change the quoting behaviour
f13bb1bed03db9d68a7d9a48aafeec78 (22:16): Geoffrey: Thanks for the info... also thanks 3f2e2531201cfbf853f16f668132eaf2. b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea
